rows.notes: Ran at a solid 30fps even at 5x native, and even still had room to fast forward.

Playable but with noticeable(~25%) slowdown when looking at the ground. Matched preferred PCSX2 settings/fixes as close as possible(search 'Ace Combat Emulation Guide'), but Aether/Nether are not quite up to snuff in their abandoned state.

Same settings as Ace Combat Zero, only tested first story mission, 50-60 FPS at 1x Native, no visual bugs. EE Cycle Rate 100% (0), EE Cycle Skip Normal (0) Frame limit enabled, normal speed 100%, OpenGL, Bilinear (PS2), Mipmapping Automatic, Trilinear Automatic, Anisotropic disabled, Blending Accuracy Ultra, Texture Preloading Partial, Hardware Download Unsynchronized (Non-deterministic)

The arcade was okay, story mode story cutscenes ran perfectly, but as soon as you start playing in story mode, it lags hard. Ive tried changing backend, aspect ratio, and various other setting but it would not speed up to 100%.

rows.game: Ace Combat Zero - The Belkan War
rows.notes: 60 FPS at 1x Native, no visual bugs. EE Cycle Rate 100% (0), EE Cycle Skip Normal (0) Frame limit enabled, normal speed 100%, OpenGL, Bilinear (PS2), Mipmapping Automatic, Trilinear Automatic, Anisotropic disabled, Blending Accuracy Ultra, Texture Preloading Partial, Hardware Download Unsynchronized (Non-deterministic)
Runs like a dream. Even got the opening movie to load correctly.  Vulkan, Nearest-Neighbor, 4 x filtering.
Doesn't work well
60hz mode
Runs great.  Some minor slowdowns, but rare.
Used fast/unsafe defaults. Some slowdown in the opening cutscene, but significant slowdown once gameplay started. Ran at about 30 - 40% speed even in High Performance mode.
Dont go past 1x. It bogs down during vehicle movement or parachuting. The aiming is wonky, but at 1x it is playable. Turn the performance to high
There's a lot of stuttering in even the first cutscene, and the shadows are wonky as well. Recommend playing the Gamecube version instead.
Played through the first mission with widescreen hacks enabled. Played without a hitch.
Runs great at 2x upscale!
Very slight frame drops in busy scenes which were probably also present on the original.
Solid performance
Solid performance, even with HD textures loaded
Runs at a consistent 60fps in OpenGL
Perfect

rows.game: Call Of Duty: World At War Final Front

rows.notes: Vulkan+ 60hz mode

Performance improves vastly with General Settings > Fast/Unsafe settings.
Title Screen still slows down, but not as much. Gameplay runs mostly fullspeed. 
However there are some minor graphical glitches such as the occasional texture pop-in.
Hardware mode set to "disable readbacks"
Runs abysmally on the title screen. Once in-game, it runs much better, but still occasionally stutters and has significant slowdown when around certain fire effects and caves.

rows.game: Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath Of Cortex

rows.notes: Tested on RP Mini

Runs perfectly after minor tweaks in settings due to graphical glitches.
Graphics:Blending Accuracy = Minimum
Advanced: Fast Texture Invalidation = Enabled, Half-Pixel Offset = Special(Texture), Skip Draw End = 1-3 (see what works for you)
Just some slight drops but runs great for sure. I'd say fine to keep at 2x (what I played).
Some hitches but totally playable, for blacked out cutscenes use "toggle software renderer" then turn it back off after cutscene.
Some dips which may be improved by lowering resolution.  Screen goes black during a cutscene when you leave the forest for the first time but it will eventually come back.
Runs flawlessly at 5x Native. Tested in the Nanman Campaign.
Solid 60 fps. Using Vulkan GPU render if that matters.
In game save sometimes corrupts in prologue.
Looks amazing in the Retroid pocket 5!

Tried on 3x resolution but was dipping very low in frame and causing audio skips. tried 2x as well and was still low in frames. Would not go above 30 FPS on native resolution. Frames still dip at native resolution but is playable at between 30-20 FPS
Stutters a bit when I make leg-breaking tackles
OpenGL, everything default
Vulkan, with widescreen patch, works great
Vulkan with hardware download mode set to Disable Readbacks
Near the end of each stage the enemy's audio sounds like it glitched a little, not a deal breaker though.
Runs flawlessly, Looks great
Works perfect, no tweaks needed
Runs perfectly at 60fps at a 3x upscale, and supports native widescreen. Vulcan + Turnip 9v2

The game runs at full speed at basically all the time, the only part that I noticied a slowdown was at the Perceus fight. But I think this was caused by a graphic glitch because of his invisibility. I beat the game and I was using version v1.9a-dev of NetherSX2
Some minor slowdowns when loading shaders
Disable readbacks for clubman stages will have low fps
Some slight slowdown sometimes but impressive and running well on Nether.

rows.game: Harry Potter And The Chamber Of Secrets
rows.notes: Game runs well sometimes, sometimes not, graphical issues too. FPS drops happpen too. I guess it can be finished.

rows.game: Harry Potter And The Prisoner Of Askaban

rows.notes: Runs excellent overall. Vulkan struggles with the shadows and darker areas. OpenGL handles those better, but has occasional visual glitches. Neither option is too bad. Widescreen patch from PCSX2's patch list works great.
OpenGL to remove strange shadowing. Scenes and gameplay runs 100% except certain unimportant locations.

Changed the following settings to fix shadows, texture flickering and models missing eyes.

Graphic Renderer = OpenGL
Graphics Settings > Blending Accuracy = High
Advanced Settings > Enable Manual Hardware Fixes 
Advanced Settings > Enable Auto Flush (Hardware)
Advanced Settings > Enable Texture Inside RT.

rows.game: Jak And Daxter - The Precursor Legacy
rows.notes:
Runs smoothly, but has some graphical glitches. Most can be fixed by changing the following settings:
Graphics Settings > Blending Accuracy = High
Advanced Settings > Enable Manual Hardware Fixes, Enable Auto Flush (Hardware),  Enable Texture Inside RT.
Graphic Renderer = OpenGL
Unfortunately some graphical bugs still occur, such as distant water not rendering correctly.
The game works fine but on 1 mission crash always in the same place
The only emulator that runs this game perfectly.

rows.game: King Of Fighters Maximum Impact Regulation A
rows.notes: 60fps OpenGL
Vulkan Required. 2x Upscale. 60 fps

Im on day two and havent had a slow down yet and ive upscaled past 1080p and it runs amazing! Also did not need it at high performance with sport fan speed. I scaled back to performance with auto fan speed and no drop in performance

rows.game: Kingdom Hearts II Final Mix Plus
rows.notes: Some small pfs dips in heavier scenes and choppiness when doing manual camera spins but completely playable. Set audio to async to minimise the perceived lag. Works just as well with x3 native but 2d textures look more out of place.

Fix for stuttering when Sun/Moon is visible:
Graphics Settings -> Hardware Download Mode -> Disable Readbacks
Vulkan. Runs perfectly
stalls on black screen on loading the game
Perfect at 2x, Playable at 3x
USA copy runs great, you can push 3x if you want no settings change
Runs perfect on default settings
OpenGL renderer, disable hardware download mode, EE Cycle skip: mild underclock

Vulkan! 3x or even more, small brakes on the selection screen, in the races is smooth.

Flawless
Hovers around 20fps and has big drops when there's an effect on screen like fire. Couldn't find settings to improve it.

rows.game: Prince Of Persia: The Sands Of Time
rows.notes: Works great with any settings. Find OpenGL a better choice. The game itself looks slow, but that's the game's "feature". 32-35 stable FPS.
60FPS, some slowdown in some particular areas (Church with lots of NPCs, some cutscenes). Graphicals glitches in some areas (also present in PCSX2 Nightly as of this time).
OpenGL, Optimal/safe defaults
Standard settings on NetherSX2, 2x res and worked great up to perfect on launch.
It runs incredibly well
Not sure what Rom region to choose in the form but it runs perfectly without any tinkering.
Ran perfectly was able to play through entire game
Perfect 30fps @ 2x, but small graphic glitches between stages, I recommend 1.5x to reduce them
Runs perfectly at 4x Native, has very rare stutters at 5x Native.
Runs well with Vulkan, occasional drops, and flickering subtitle text in some videos.
Completed game some small artifacts in cut scene but really very few ( redish borders but nothing gamebreaking)

Finished the game at 20-50 FPS with these settings:
EE Cycle Skip - Mild Underclock(1)
GPU Renderer - Vulkan

With all other settings, the intro stutters at the end and the flying sand colossus lags too
EE Timing Hack and OPH Flag don't help
This game is notoriously hard to run, og PS2 runs it at 15 FPS sometimes

Somewhat stuttery 30 FPS, Vulkan, Widescreen (in-game, no patch), Standard performance mode. Slim transparent lines on top + left of screen, can remove top line with in-game 'Screen Placement' setting.
Japan-only game. EE Cycle Rate 180% (2). Sometimes drops to 57fps but perfect besides that
EE Cycle Rate = 130% to get mostly 60fps

OpenGL, Fast/unsafe defaults

FPS dips here and there, but still fairly smooth. FMV's can stutter slightly.
Settings: Open GL, FXAA Shader on, Instant VU1 off. (Can be framey at times but it works)

rows.game: Sly Cooper And The Thievius Raccoonus

Using the native 16:9 support in the game instead of widescreen patches.
Game works smoothly or terribly depending on the stage.  Certain stages, like the Egyptian Temple, have certain lighting effects that slow the game down extremely when on screen.

rows.game: Star Ocean: Till The End Of Time
rows.notes: Unfortunately, there's some occasional graphical artifacts. A microstutter at the start of battles sometimes, might be reduced on lower resolutions. Otherwise runs great. Tested in the Ruins of Barr and the first cutscene.

Vulkan, Fast/unsafe defaults

Some slowdown occurs on the first mission. The following missions were completely smooth. Could possibly occur later in the game.
Low FPS (in the 20s) even in the tutorial bit. It doesn't bode well for the rest of the game.
Fan translated japanese version works great
Works Perfectly

Plays near flawlessly... unless you're in the ever-so troublesome Ogre Temple stage. Then the game slows down significantly, and going down to 1x Native doesn't help. Since whether you fight on this stage is more or less random, I can't really rate this higher than Playable.
This game favours Vulkan backend, stable 60fps at X2 resolution scale

rows.game: The King Of Fighters 98 Ultimate Match
rows.notes: Play is great with very few graphics bugs.
The King of Fighters 2006 is the US release of The King of Fighters Maximum Impact 2. Played through Mai Shiranui's story mode, and performance never dipped once.
OpenGL seems to be the best renderer. Loading screen artwork missing.
Slowdown in graphically intense areas but will run generally well on high performance
It does not need to be at 3.5x, but its the only game ive tried so far that can run this well.

rows.notes: Native Resolution, have not tested up-scaling as default settings are 100% compatible and never slow down.
some minor slow downs but runs very smoothly

Suffers from random slowdowns when traversing the map, but otherwise solid performance.
Generally runs at or around 100% speed, but often has periods of erratic frametime.
Works perfectly

Works Perfectly
Stage 9 has some weird sun ray glitchy during the beginning area but goes away when you move to the next are
Runs great, barely any frame rate dips.

Occasional dips to 30fps or lower in stages with lots of bloom lighting (top of cathedral, end of main story mode), can sometimes require going to the emulator pause menu and back to resume full speed. Otherwise stays at 60fps, Standard power profile.

Ran basically perfect for the most part. fully finished the whole game (10 hours) and ran into all but one flaw, where it dipped into about 20 fps for 5 sec before reverting back to 60fps. During the end boss battle...

Runs stable enough when racing consistently. runs into an issue where, when you crash and get back onto the track it slows down real badly for about 5 sec. this never really effected me too much, but definitely ruined the immersion and consistency of an intense race.

played through about 45 min so far, and i do have major slow downs with the initial open outside area of the tutorial. it also majorly drops frames with too many enemies. could try a different emulator, but for NetherSX2 it ruins the immersion with the constant slow downs.  definitely playable if you're okay with occasion frame drops and can ignore it...

rows.game: Dirge of Cerberus: Final Fantasy VII
rows.notes: Switch between fast and optimal settings when you experience slowdowns, typically in cutscenes.
